paper_abstract: Petri net structures are used as communicationmodel of network systems where message transfer channels are represented by the nets' edges, communicating agents - by nets' places and actions of communication - by nets' transitions, which here are called transmissions. The role of (structured) tokens play send/receive statements, that arrive at random, which makes the distribution of edges change dynamically. In this sense a net is self- modyfying: although the set of agents- places is fixed, the channels and communicating actions vary in the course of the net activity. Problems of deadlock and fairness is investigated.
paper_title: Self-Modifying Nets for Synchronous, Connection-Oriented, Multicast Communication
